shortBio: is a freelance writer based in Dallas whose work has appeared in Texas Monthly, D Magazine, and The Dallas Morning News, where he is a regular contributor covering arts and culture in North Texas.

longBio.paragraph: I’m a writer living outside Dallas, Texas and a regular contributor to The Dallas Morning News covering local arts and culture. Stories of mine have also been featured in Texas Monthly and D Magazine.

My work for The Dallas Morning News has included feature-length deep-dives (like this one!) as well as quick-turnaround stories written with our digital readers in mind. In addition to reporting, I also work closely with the newspaper’s Arts editorial staff to expand their digital audience. This summer, I led a redesign of the Arts section’s email newsletter, which I write and send out to our readers every Monday.

Before moving to Dallas, I ran an award-winning local urbanism blog in Houston called Swamplot. At Swamplot, I reported daily on real estate, architecture, city planning, and local environmental issues. The Houston Chronicle called us “one of the most important players in urban design” when we stopped publishing earlier this year.

Some of my favorite stories include this feature I wrote about Dallas’ professional foosball scene, this story on a young artist from Amarillo, this on a sculptor’s home in the woods outside Beaumont, this on a building with arms, this on the demise of a local landmark, and this interactive piece I wrote — and coded in Python — to map where buildings were demolished in Houston last year.

links.linkText: sculptor’s home in the woods outside Beaumont

longBio.paragraph: I graduated from Columbia University in 2017 with a double major in creative writing and anthropology. I grew up in New Jersey, but after interning at Texas Monthly and D Magazine, I decided to stick around Texas.
